column2: The coast of Nordland has been ravaged by Norse raiders, but no longer! Franz knows this is a test of his sovereignty, that the unconvinced Electors will be watching and even hoping he fails. So he must face the Norsemen and be victorious. They will come in waves, like the very sea itself!

With Kroq-Gar’s legions hissing, fierce and ready, it is time to march on the Fallen Gates. The Elf servants have blasphemed not just by leaving Ulthuan, but by daring to interfere with the Cosmic Gates - an ancient device that can open a portal into the Realm of Chaos. For such a heinous transgression, the Elves must be punished as decreed by the Lord of Solar-City. The gates are surrounded by a deep crevasse that must be crossed before the Asur are truly engaged. The trespassers will try to stop Kroq-Gar, but that is their mistake to make!

These Orcs may be savages but they have yet to face the Slaughterer. Those on the hill are a formidable force, but will not be the only enemies in the forthcoming battle. Azhag must be wary of the flanks, for this is where the savages will surely strike once the hill attack begins.
Battle for the Vortex: Thwart Malekith
Battle for the Vortex: Counter Tyrion

This is where the Slaughterer's name was first screamed in terror by the wretches of the Empire. But to earn that title Azhag must fight! The Warboss will face two armies of humies, and will even confront a deadly steam tank. Should he be victorious he will be etched into the bloody history of the Empire!

What started out as a hunt to punish some Norscans for murdering Manann's creatures has now become an emotionally-charged family affair. Aranessa may have been born Norscan, but her allegiance has always been to the sea. Rejected and betrayed by her own flesh and blood as a baby, she now has a chance to appease the bitterness raging eternally inside her.

column1: The Skjold chieftain claiming to be her birth father has just launched a raid against Pack Ice Bay. Aranessa vows that no more innocent creatures of the sea shall die in her name – this ends now!

column2: Even though Alith Anar walks into this willingly, the battle is still a trap. The Shadow King must use all of Loec's tricks to evade capture and make the Dark Elves pay for this brazen and doomed act. Like the shadows the king and his warriors are named after, the Asur must remain evasive and not get pinned down, for that is when the Dark Elves might actually get the upper hand.

Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?
Battle for the Vortex: Oppose Mazdamundi

The Dwarfs plant their oath stones at a crossroads - a defiant gesture to the creatures of Troll Country. The throng will not be moved until the cull has happened. The Dawi will stand firm as wave after wave of monsters are drawn to what they think is prey. It will be a long haul, but the purge must happen!

These violent desires must not come to fruition. Orion is all that stands between the Oak of Ages and the utter ruin of Athel Loren. They will come from the south, intent on breaking through Orion's defences and attacking the Oak, but the king will stand firm. Indeed he must, for the alternative is the destruction of the forest as he knows it. Yet Anath Raema is determined, she will see the rebel band is reinforced with her minions where possible. Orion and his forces must be ever-vigilant, although with all of Athel Loren behind him and the power of Ariel within his soul he cannot fail. He will not fail! He will see these dark desires meet a violent end and peace return to Athel Loren's gentle glades.

While this is not necessarily an evil place, it is a place of death. The spirits within resent the presence of the living. Even so, Gelt has fought the Undead before, and this will surely be a small presence. He looks to the men, demands valour and then begins to channel the Winds of Magic.

While the eyes of Men struggle with fighting underground, the Skaven excel, and it is in this warren that Queek will have his vengeance over the ratman that has taunted him many times. The boaster’s armour will be Queek's property! But a note of caution… this enemy has proven tricksy from the start - as the hordes meet in battle, no doubt further traps will have been set!
Battle for the Vortex: Oppose Mazdamundi

At last! The false prophet has stopped hiding like a coward, and is forced to face Wurrzag. The Goblin has taken position on a hill, where he’ll be difficult to shift. But just before Wurrzag commits to battle, he falls into a trance - Gork is talking to him. The Great Green God warns his Shaman that the sneaky Gobbo is laying a trap and more of his mates are skulking close by. Gits!

The foul stench of Necromancy infects every inch of this accursed field. If the glades are to be restored to their former sanctity, this scourge must be expunged. Yet the Eldest of Ancients must take care; more Undead will filter onto the field as the Necromancer takes hold of more cadavers. Durthu must strike fast and cut the head from this serpent. The Necromancer himself must fall, for it is he who controls these shuffling thralls. Once he is gone, they will soon lose their sense of purpose. One fell strike with all the strength of the Ancients behind him and Durthu will see this blight excised and the forests restored!

This battle will be fought against a Knightly Order of the Empire. Armoured man-filth will be a challenge, as they are tough to gore and mobile due to their treacherous beasts. Corner them at the river and deal with them quickly, before reinforcements arrive!

Settra arrives at the reliquary, only to encounter a combined force of Humans and Dwarfs preparing to desecrate the site and thieve away his sacred blade. For such an affront, their souls are forfeit!

Settra must have discovered Arkhan's quest for the Staff of Nagash, for he has gifted it to a Skaven warlord in return for the Liche King's destruction. Arkhan faces a desperate fight indeed, though if he succeeds, the staff will be his to wield at last!

Khalida arrays her forces at a crossing on the Ash River. A large Undead army, led by the cursed Lahmian Vampires, marches west towards the Black Pyramid of Nagash, no doubt with nefarious intent. On the opposite bank of the river, the cavalry vanguard of the vampires marches to cross the river. The time is nigh. Asaph has her champion, and she shall have her vengeance!

A mighty battle awaits, for the prize is great! The urks will not make this easy, for they have gathered in great numbers and, as news of the Dwarfs coming spreads across the rest of the Peaks, more Greenskins will no doubt come to join the fray. This is Ironhammer's moment - should he be victorious, then he could well be the first of the Angrund line to wield King Lunn’s hammer in generations!

The map that came into Count Noctilus’ possession is no trap – it has led him to an unchartered island in the Great Ocean where the treasure chest containing Captain Roth’s Moondial is located. As he approaches the island, however, it appears his map is not the only one in existence – a large army of treasure-hunting soldiers of fortune has somehow found its way there ahead of him and pitched camp at the top of a hill. Before the day is out, Noctilus will surely have made yet more of the dead to raise into his Undead ranks!

This is a tough fight amongst the beast-paths of the darkest forest. Malagor faces a Gorebull and his fierce Minotaur warherd. The Crowfather should use his superior arcane abilities to defeat and dominate the crude but powerful Minotaurs.
Battle for the Vortex: Foil Queek

The Orcs are ready for Gelt. They stand in the centre of the gully, rudely gesturing, egging on Gelt's retinue. The Wizard is cautious, he senses that all is not as simple as it seems and there is something ancient, and large, lurking close…

The Orcs are ready for Gelt. They stand in the centre of the gully, rudely gesturing, egging on Gelt's retinue. The Wizard is cautious, he senses that all is not as simple as it seems and there is something ancient, and large, lurking close…

Arkhan has located the Lizardmen responsible for looting Alcadizaar's tomb. They are attempting to resurrect the Nehekharan warrior-king themselves, denying Arkhan the soul he so desperately seeks to empower his ancient Tomb Blade. They know too much, they dare too much - this ends here!
Battle for the Vortex: Counter Tyrion

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.

column1: You are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.
That is, of course, only if you let him…

column2: Battle for the Vortex: Foil Queek
Dragon Cloak of Fyrskar, Broken Leg Gully (2)

It has been many years since Madame Cylostra was the favoured court singer of Bretonnian royalty, a distinction she intends to have once more. Having spotted a galleon of Bretonnian troops disembarked on a nearby island, she has little time to waste. If she can get close enough, she will give them the show of a lifetime and remind them what they’ve been missing all these years!
Battle for the Vortex: Thwart Malekith

The foul stench of Necromancy infects every inch of this accursed field. If the glades are to be restored to their former sanctity, this scourge must be expunged. Yet the Eldest of Ancients must take care; more Undead will filter onto the field as the Necromancer takes hold of more cadavers. Durthu must strike fast and cut the head from this serpent. The Necromancer himself must fall, for it is he who controls these shuffling thralls. Once he is gone, they will soon lose their sense of purpose. One fell strike with all the strength of the Ancients behind him and Durthu will see this blight excised and the forests restored!

Ghorst has found the Cult of Sigmar's excavation site, where the Arch Lector searches for the lost pages of the Liber Noctus. Once the  Cult of Sigmar has the casket that holds the pages, then Ghorst will strike - an ambush to take the Empire men by surprise and rid them of both their lives and the cursed pages! Ghorst's plan is a sound one, but his Vampiress ally counsels caution - the Cult of Sigmar's resources are vast and should the Arch Lector come under attack then reinforcements are likely!

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.

column1: You are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.
That is, of course, only if you let him…

column2: Battle for the Vortex: Foil Queek

The slaughter of so many Greenskins close to an Arcane Fulcrum should provide the right conditions for the Count to bind the necromantic energy into an artefact. He must destroy this Goblin Shaman and his underlings defending the pillar and do it before any Greenskin reinforcements arrive!

Although the Fay Enchantress did much and more with her potion, summoning a spell of unmatched power, the fiends of Chaos still managed to land on Bretonnian shores, though in numbers much diminished. Their force still poses great danger, however, if it is not defeated here.

column1: The effects of the potion yet linger upon the beleaguered enemy, however, which gives the Bretonnians an edge. The Fay Enchantress has spent much of her strength on the storm that destroyed the fleet, yet the Winds of Magic still blow strong; she should be able to continue to attack them through magical means. Though they are numerous, the Chaos hordes are fatigued and susceptible to attack; take advantage of this and show them no quarter - the ocean is only retreat for them!

column2: Battle for the Vortex: Thwart Malekith
Battle for the Vortex: Counter Tyrion
Battle for the Vortex: Oppose Mazdamundi

Hel Fenn, a place Mannfred is not fond of for historical reasons. But these mortals pose no such threat! They are few in number and while they have a strong position between two rocks, they can be flanked easily enough. It will not take long for these fools to join our Unliving ranks!

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.

column1: You are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.
That is, of course, only if you let him…

column2: These pathetic forest-dwelling Elves come for Morghur, but he must hold fast. The ritual is well underway - he cannot let Ariel and her minions take from him that which he has toiled over for so long. Morghur is beset, but the position is defensible; the waves of Elves will come and crash upon the Beastmen as waves crash upon the rocks. They shall leave nothing for Ariel to identify them by. A Ruinous power flows through Morghur, so that he might smite the Elven pretenders with Chaotic fury!

Thorgrim must defend the pass, as his ancestors have done many times before. Let us hope that the umgi will heed the summons and send forth their own warriors. In the meantime the High King's throng must fight and hold back the green tide.

Khatep and his retinue enter the pitch dark tomb, and in a stroke, the terrible truth is revealed. Before his army, a ravening horde of Beastmen stretches, ready to charge - and at their backs, the Priests of Nagash. Treachery! The trail of breadcrumbs… the false litany... the lure of redemption - it is all an elaborate deception, fiendishly wrought to tantalise him, to draw him to this place and to his destruction. As the pieces fall into place in Khatep’s mind, his outrage is consumed in the white heat of fury. The foul apostates will pay with their souls – as will their beast-kin thralls!

The Siren of the Storm has waited a long time for this. It is still unclear whether the Phoenix King is part of High Elf contingent she is trailing, but their flags and standards indicate that they are undoubtedly associated with High Elf royalty. Such an eminent audience deserves Cylostra’s best performance!

Skrolk enters the mortuary and is immediately suspicious, for the fetid air stinks of Dark Magic yet is unfamiliar to him. He sends his horde forth and they scamper around the bloated corpses of the Man-things, towards the Liber Bubonicus. But then the corpses start to stir, and rise to fight once again. Some ancient reptilian enchantment has been activated, and now Skrolk must fight those he has already killed!

The Elves have a saying that once a sword is drawn then it should not be sheathed again until the offender’s blood is spilt. Tyrion finds himself accused of Dark Elf sympathies by the Loremasters - it matters little that this situation has been brought about by the intrigues of selfish princes jealous of Tyrion’s influence over the Phoenix King. For now, swords have been drawn and blood must indeed be spilt! Tyrion must expect to face powerful magic and ranks of elite Swordmasters.

Karl Franz has so far shunned the use of Ghal Maraz - symbol of the Emperor - for fear of further angering those hostile to his coronation. But should he be victorious this day, then the warhammer can be claimed with clear conscience! But first he must face a massive army of Orcs and Goblins in Black Fire Pass, just as Sigmar did before him; and as with Sigmar over two thousand years ago, he hopes that the Dwarfs will be there as allies!

Is this now or centuries ago? Archaon cares not, his eyes are only on the prize worn by the challenger. Should he win he gains another relic of the Everchosen, the Armour of Morkar himself. But first he must be victorious, and such trials will be anything but easy, for the Dark Gods take great delight in playing with their champions - especially those fated for greatness.

This Glade Lord is beyond salvation! She has given herself wholly to the dark lord Slaanesh; she is nothing more than a puppet of Chaos now, she must be purged! Her retinue lies across from Orion, but there will doubtless be more coming to her aid. This aid will not take the form of Elves, however, as the Ruinous Powers seek to secure their fleeting foothold on this realm. Dark and corrupted forces will try to stop Orion in his endeavour, but he must hold firm against them all and recover the relic before it is snatched away beyond his reach.
Cloak of Molten Metal, Broken Leg Gully (1)
Cloak of Molten Metal, Broken Leg Gully (2)

A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

The Hound God sits brooding upon a vast and ornately carved brass throne atop a great mountain of blood-stained bones, observing the progress of other Champions with disdain. Although impressed by slaughter, it is insulted when the killing is not done in its name, so sends its own challenger…

This city is evil, even for an Orc of Azhag's temperament. Yet the loot in the city is worth the risk, even if that risk is facing against Chaos and the Undead. The Chaos forces will be attacking from within the ruins, Gork knows where the Undead will be striking from! Watch the skies, for they will be full of "vile fings".

Dwarfs travelling along this lost dark road are ripe for an ambush. Don't let the beardy gits form a defensive perimeter. Get 'em in the flanks nice an' early and den smack 'em from behind with da big stuff!

So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

Volkmar's crusaders have caught the Undead traversing the Fenn. Now is the time to strike and rescue the Jade Griffon from their evil designs. The Vampires will not shun battle, yet Hel Fenn has a cursed history, and one that does not favour the von Carsteins. However, there are plenty of bodies about to summon forth and bolster their shambling hordes, so whilst the Grand Theogonist should strike quickly, the Sigmarites must also be wary of reinforcements.

The Witch King desires the power contained within the Shrine of Ultimate Darkness, and what Malekith wants, he usually gets, Ulthuan’s destruction aside... For their part, the Chaos Gods know full well what the Witch King plans and so send their mortal followers to thwart him.

column1: The forces of Chaos will come thick and fast - such is their desperate need to please their malignant Gods!

column2: The self-proclaimed ‘King of Trolls’ had been without his crown for quite some time. Heading southward into civilised lands to search for it, Throgg eventually finds himself pursuing a treasure-hoarding Runelord who he believes has it in his possession. As he catches up to the Runelord’s convoy, Throgg sees that the Dwarf force have not been caught off-guard and are expecting him, so an ambush is not possible. They have already taken up a defensive position at a small chokepoint in the road. Best be quick – this is the Dwarf heartland after all.

The ancient Crow God is very established amongst the Norscan tribes, personified as a gigantic and massively bloated creature surrounded by dark clouds of tiny daemonic insects. It is thought to be a ‘generous’ spirit, always interested in the plight of its mortal followers. Now, however, that generosity has worn thin for those who have rejected it, and so its repulsive challenger is sent to deliver punishment.

The Orcs and the Undead are no match for the mighty Shaggoth, yet together they could prove a significant threat. Deal with the fleeing Greenskin mobs quickly, for the Undead will continue to summon more powerful servants to their thrall!

While any other of mortal birth would fear a Lord of Change, Archaon cares little. He knows of these creatures that, while they are impressive on the battlefield compared to mundane warriors, it is their arcane might he must vanquish. But when Tzeentch's Greater Daemon is banished back to the Realm of Chaos, leaving the Crown of Domination in its wake, then the End Times will truly begin.

The Everchosen faces a powerful magic-user. Should Archaon strike quickly he could kill this sorcerer-king and claim the Slayer of Kings as his reward. But if the warlock lingers he will summon wave after wave of foes to fight against. Even a being such as Archaon could be overwhelmed, in theory at least.

Vlad's hopes of a speedy raid against the mine are thwarted. The site is claimed by a king of the Strigoi and his ghoul swarms - the pathetic legacy of a doomed people that worshipped Nagash as a god. The creature is unimpressed by the Count, refusing to kowtow to Vlad or give him leave to take the Warpstone. Vlad's anger rises, and so the Undead will meet each other in battle!

These fell Uzkular may not be the object of Ungrim's Quest, yet they represent a threat to the forces of order and so must be slain all the same. The howls of long-dead wolves play across the battlefield and it is clear that the robed figure and two more of his vile brethren are close.

A grand alliance of the Empire and Bretonnia has mustered. It is a desperate act, the dying throes of a race close to extinction, yet a cornered beast is at times the most dangerous. Bretonnian cavalry are working in concert with the Empire's artillery and ranked infantry. Caution is advised, for we must strike at the right moment or be undone by this most-disciplined of hosts!

These violent desires must not come to fruition. Orion is all that stands between the Oak of Ages and the utter ruin of Athel Loren. They will come from the south, intent on breaking through Orion's defences and attacking the Oak, but the king will stand firm. Indeed he must, for the alternative is the destruction of the forest as he knows it. Yet Anath Raema is determined, she will see the rebel band is reinforced with her minions where possible. Orion and his forces must be ever-vigilant, although with all of Athel Loren behind him and the power of Ariel within his soul he cannot fail. He will not fail! He will see these dark desires meet a violent end and peace return to Athel Loren's gentle glades.

The so-called Middenheimers march in the clumsy way of the uncloven. They come searching for Khazrak; they will find him, but it will be on the Banebeast’s terms, for Khazrak will catch Todbringer and his foolish wolves in an ambush! The Beastlord must be ready to strike at the right moment. One-Eye knows that to launch an attack too early, or even too late, could be the warherd's undoing.

The Dark Gods have sent Wulfrik the Wanderer visions, compelling him to travel deep into the Bretonnian heartland to duel a famous hero who is as yet unknown to him. To draw out his mysterious adversary, Wulfrik must attack the site of a keep said to contain important holy relics and stately heirlooms of the Bretonnian Kingdom. The first thing to do is to slaughter the pathetic rabble they have sent to defend it, then maybe this so-called champion will make an appearance!

The Plaguelord has come to the Isle of the Crimson Skull in search of a rare mineral; the unholy Skull that dominates this place will restore the Rod of Corruption. But the Lizardmen are aware of Skrolk’s movements and have been tracking their nemesis since his recent slaughter of their spawn-kin. The time for inaction is over. The isle is a sacred place, for the Old Ones once roamed there. To let the Rat-spawn enter the island’s interior is unthinkable, so the foes meet upon the beach…

The ancient enemy, or their mortal servants, have come to the Fallen Gates to stop their activation. Lord Mazdamundi must defend the Gates at all costs. A chasm separates the two armies; the most ancient of Slann would do well to use this as an advantage but beware the enemy’s flying minions.

While the Witch King himself is absent from the initial attack of Vaul’s Anvil, he sends forth his best to deal with Teclis. The volcano rages all around, as if it knows that battle is inevitable. Teclis has sent word to his brother, but has no notion where Tyrion is or if he will even answer the summons. And so the High Loremaster must face the forces of the Witch King alone, but he is not afraid, for he is Teclis, Defender of Ulthuan!

The walls of Arnheim offend the Dark Elves with their pure and wholesome tone. It is time to rip them down, and kill whoever is on the other side! Some will need to be taken alive, of course. Should the colony be taken the High Elf defenders are under no illusion as to what their fates will be, and so prepare to fight like trapped vermin!

The Dwarfs are ambushing! If they know they have been manipulated by Grand Warlord Gnawdwell as merely tools to test Queek, they care not. For they despise Headtaker more than any other thaggoraki! A chance to slay an enemy who features prominently in the Great Book of Grudges is not one the Dawi are willing to pass up. The ambush begins!

Dark Elves block the way to the Well of Time. The fissure within, from which Tlanxla reaches out across the eons, will only remain open for so long, so Kroq-Gar must act quickly to vanquish the threat. However, the terrain is far from an open field and the Elves are notoriously cunning and difficult to bring to battle!
The Slayer Crown, Ancient Dragon Cave
Amulet of Sea Gold, Marbad's Tomb

The ratmen step from the shadows, one wearing the War Crown at a jaunty angle to deliberately mock the High Elves. Whether the creatures were in league with Terrorgheist all along, or are just rampant opportunists, it does not matter. What is far more important is that the War Crown is returned to its rightful owner. The Skaven may have Teclis and his host surrounded, but the ratmen must now deal with one of the most powerful mages to ever have lived!

The Wood Elves are beset by tribulation! The Undead are swift and nimble; they will be upon Durthu's allies in short order! Whilst they can hold on for now, he must move swiftly to aid them or they will be completely overrun by the Undead menace. The Ashenhall is a craggy, obstacle-laden place, with many natural points of defence - the terrain is advantageous to he who holds it. Durthu must hold the enemy at bay until the Elves can regroup, then together they can smite the eldritch blight from these lands!

The Skaven dare trespass on the Isle of the Crimson Skull, a place the Old Ones themselves once thought a haven. The ratmen must be destroyed and the Cobra Mace reclaimed, but the Skink attendants note caution as the Skaven have hauled large catapults ashore, giving them considerable firepower. They have no consideration for the safety of their countless underlings - as well as being armed to the teeth, the Skaven are also willing to sacrifice their slaves whilst their artillery is brought to bear. The Lizardmen must also be wary, for the Rat-spawn are the sneakiest of tricksters in this world and will almost certainly attempt to outflank their Saurus warriors in a most underhand way!

So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!
The Icons of Vilification, Stir River

The herd, and Morghur with it, had no idea that Orion and his warriors had located and infiltrated their secret beast-paths. And so the Elves descend upon them with pride and vengeance in their hearts. However, they are deep within enemy territory now and do not know from which direction further Beastmen may come to aid their brothers and forestall Elven vengeance. And so Orion must be swift, he must be strong and above all he must be furious; let the rage of the ancient forest of Athel Loren rain destruction upon these calamitous fiends, that they never darken the forest again.
The Icons of Vilification, The Shadow Forest

With Kroq-Gar’s legions hissing, fierce and ready, it is time to march on the Fallen Gates. The Elf servants have blasphemed not just by leaving Ulthuan, but by daring to interfere with the Cosmic Gates - an ancient device that can open a portal into the Realm of Chaos. For such a heinous transgression, the Elves must be punished as decreed by the Lord of Solar-City. The gates are surrounded by a deep crevasse that must be crossed before the Asur are truly engaged. The trespassers will try to stop Kroq-Gar, but that is their mistake to make!

The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

At last an army worthy of restoring Blood Drinker! The vessels are many and so Vlad's sword shall drink deeply. The battlefield is large and open, the Empire's generals think they can outflank and outmanoeuvre the Undead hosts. Vlad should use this learning against them if he is to seek victory.

With Kroq-Gar’s legions hissing, fierce and ready, it is time to march on the Fallen Gates. The Elf servants have blasphemed not just by leaving Ulthuan, but by daring to interfere with the Cosmic Gates - an ancient device that can open a portal into the Realm of Chaos. For such a heinous transgression, the Elves must be punished as decreed by the Lord of Solar-City. The gates are surrounded by a deep crevasse that must be crossed before the Asur are truly engaged. The trespassers will try to stop Kroq-Gar, but that is their mistake to make!

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine.

column1: Arkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

column2: Here come the stunties again, but there's more of them and they seem even angrier than before. Good! Such dark emotions will further empower Skarsnik's new prodder, making the artefact even more spiteful. First, though, he must be victorious. The flanking worked last time, but will the stubborn Dwarfs fall for the same 'tricksy trap' a second time?

That hill, Grudsnik's Mound, is the key. And the humies are camped on it. But these humies like their nags, no doubt they're behind the hill ready to flank Azhag's force. But Azhag wasn't born yesterday - he don't know when 'ee woz born! - he'll need to make sure the humies and nags don't catch him off guard - smash the hill-based gits before the pincer closes!

The Lizardmen may have taken their enchanted gold back, but Luthor Harkon is already closing in. The wily pirate has spies all around the Vampire Coast's borders and on its outlying islets, so a Lizardmen army of such a vast size could not simply move around Lustria without him hearing of their whereabouts. He knows precisely where the gold is, and now it is his for the taking - anything that gets in his way will be swiftly dealt with, for death comes to all who oppose the Pirate King!

The forces of Karak Azul are already in the midst of fighting when Grombrindal's throng deploys. It was a dangerous task, but one the proud Dwarfs of that Hold willingly volunteered for. However, now the White Dwarf must come to their aid or risk dishonour!

column1: As Gotrek previously warned, this Greenskin horde is full of monsters -a fetish of the Warboss, but one that the Dawi will easily overcome. Thundering Falls makes for a perfect trap through which to take on such creatures, which is why it was chosen, but hopefully the Warboss was not canny enough to keep back any monstrous reserves!

column2: Secrecy and stealth are the Everqueen's allies as her war host seeks to take the higher ground and gain a key tactical advantage against the mortal servants of the Dark Gods. The enemy has placed his artillery forces on a hill to the east. How the Everqueen deals with them will be the key to unlocking victory.

Settra's force has located those in possession of the Crown of Nehekhara. Possibly thinking that the crown will protect them from the Imperishable’s unending wrath, they are hidden in a forested area, from which they believe a trap can be sprung. They are, of course, wrong.
Amulet of Sea Gold, Estalian Tomb

The thief stands upon the brow of a hill, surrounded by a horde of Undead. We must be wary, for she is a formidable enemy and will no doubt use her accursed Dark Magic to bring forth more corpses to aid her plight.

The thief stands upon the brow of a hill, surrounded by a horde of Undead. We must be wary, for she is a formidable enemy although the surrounding floods will at least ensure that she cannot raise further reinforcements!

The Chaos horde are not going to let a Patriarch of the Empire swoop in and take their prize. Balthasar must face the might of a mounted Chaos army led by a Chaos Lord in full raiment. This Champion of Chaos will gain much favour from his dark masters by slaying such a powerful servant of Franz. The battle will be bloody indeed.

While others quail at the thought of fighting Chaos, for Grimgor this is more than a mere challenge - it is an absolute joy! Be wary though, if the Northmen worship the Blood God then it'll be a straight-up scrap, but if they are dedicated to one of the sneakier powers, then there may be a few surprises or even traps to confront.

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.

column1: You are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.
That is, of course, only if you let him…

column2: No more guile, now is the time to match blades in open battle. This horde is heavy with Orcs, but there are Trolls within the ranks too. Good! For what is the use of a Troll-slayer if there are no Trolls to slay!

A great prize awaits the hunter who dares brave the most desolate reaches of the northern tundra. One particular herd of mammoths known as the Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord has earned notoriety throughout the tribes for having the most powerful and unpredictably aggressive beasts in its parade. Slaying them will surely bring great favour!

The Abyssal Shrieker is a terrible flying beast of legend, shrouded in macabre myth. This nightmare of the sky, whose shrieks of the damned emanate from the Ruinous Realm itself, is of the giant Undead bat species known as Terrorgheists. Little is known about the Abyssal Shrieker, except that many a hunter has fallen trying to fell it!

Blorgar the Mad Titan is a brutish and highly flatulent Giant wreaking havoc in the Grey Mountains. As his name suggests, he has no real agenda except to mindlessly trample settlements and squish their inhabitants under his colossal wart-ridden feet. The Dark Gods may favour such an unpredictable and destructive being, but they shall surely favour you more for slaying it in their name!

Somewhere amongst the lush glades of Athel Loren lives Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots. Although the Wood Elves are highly adept at protecting their territory, when the forest is in real peril this mighty Forest Dragon will come to their aid. It is a terrific bounty, but in sacrificing it you will be depriving the forest of one of its champions - it will not be given up easily!

As creatures of Chaos, Dragon Ogre Shaggoths are a highly-favourable sacrifice to the Dark Gods, but also extremely difficult to bring down. Their strength and power are proportional to their age, making the millennia-old Traygard Mountain-Cleaver in particular a truly-challenging target for the hunt. Beware the lightning!

Arachnarok Queens are the type of despicable poisonous monster that should not be trifled with. One Venom Queen is hard enough to bring down, but to take on this bounty you will have to face multiple Queens – the Brood Queens of Karak Azul. All in a day’s hunt!

A dangerous, murderous Frost-Wyrm is a great offering to the Gods indeed, and none are more dangerous and murderous than Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void. It appears only where the worst snow storms fall, so to hunt it down you must battle the worst of the elements as well as the monster itself.

Perhaps the scariest of all giant humanoid monster species, Cygors are some of the angriest creatures to roam the Old World. The Salzenmund Soul-Eaters are a pair of Cygors even bigger and stronger than others of their kind, making them among the most difficult monsters to hunt. Their cycloptic eyes not only see the Winds of Magic, but also dampen their use for most spellcasters in their presence.

The White Dwarf faces a massive Chaos army, the like of which has not been seen in many years. Grombrindal and his throng steel themselves for the task ahead; he is glad its ranks are so numerous as he must slay many to fulfil his oath!

Khazrak has caught his rival in-between raids on the man-filth towns. It is an excellent moment to strike - while much of the enemy herd are still in the midst of raiding. Hit Graktar's Gors quickly, for they will be certain to call back the herds to defend their lame master.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine.

column1: Arkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

column2: This area is deep in Savage Orc territory. The brutes stand guardian over their pathetic effigies atop a hill. A strong legion will send the green fools scattering, so we must be wary of any reinforcements that may come from the flanks. Assuming such savages have that foresight, of course.

Glorious! The Beast of Raema is just as the legends proclaim - the creature's many heads will make perfect trophies and a worthy sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Its Beastmen acolytes bray with a madness you have not seen in the Cloven Ones before, so be wary when tackling them. But enough posturing - the hunt nears its end and there is a monster to slay!

Through the stinking, cramped tunnels you go and then finally you emerge at Seep-Gore, lair of the Hellbeast. The creature lumbers forward, its straining abdomen appearing to pulse as if barely constraining the hordes within its distended belly.

column1: The monster is truly is an abomination! Its heads will make many trophies and a worthy dedication to the Dark Gods... Kill it!

column2: The so-called Middenheimers march in the clumsy way of the uncloven. They come searching for Khazrak; they will find him, but it will be on the Banebeast’s terms, for Khazrak will catch Todbringer and his foolish wolves in an ambush! The Beastlord must be ready to strike at the right moment. One-Eye knows that to launch an attack too early, or even too late, could be the warherd's undoing.

Gashtooth’s army gathers to face Wurrzag’s boyz. Suspiciously, there doesn’t seem to be anyone about... yet. Wurrzag’s scout re-joins the force, looking worse for wear. He tried to use his ‘in-ish-a-tive’ to capture one of these soopa-Squigs but the beast got so angry it exploded! Looks like these mushrooms may harbour some lethal side-effects!

column1: As the Greenskin hordes prepare to charge each other Gashtooth produces the Squiggly Beast. In a taunting gesture he shows Wurrzag’s pet a glowing mushroom. The beast - always hungry - tries to grab the mushroom but it is kept tantalisingly out of reach. If Wurrzag wants his pet back - and unchanged - he needs to attack now! Waaagh!

column2: The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine.

column1: Arkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

column2: The Witch King has come upon the Mosquito Swamps and sees that they are guarded by Lizardmen. The reptiles are an annoyance that must be fought if Malekith is to claim back his Spellshield. He calls out to the Dark Elves Captain Strenious has hidden to ambush him, telling them that they will now work for him or face his wrath. It is now the Lizardmen that face an ambush.
So it is, the Empire must fight against its own kind for survival within the bounds of the Empire itself. We must be wary for there are more than traitors lurking in Bloodpine Woods.

On this occasion, the fury of the Beastmen is unmatched, as is their strength. Isabella and her forces must pick their adversaries carefully, lest their strength and unnatural bravery sees her army put to rout. Yet there is strength in sending her Undead hordes against this savage enemy - they can be summoned from their graves to do the Countess' bidding without protest or question. With the Undead at her command, Isabella will surely emerge victorious!
Blood Chalice of Bathori: Marbad's Tomb

The source of this vile mist is made apparent, yet here at its source it is thicker and more obfuscating than ever. At the heart of the fog lies a great army of Greenskins who can be heard beyond the obscuring effluvium with much yelling, grunting, clattering, zogging and twatting. Bretonnian Knights have thus far managed to hold back all incursions into their precious realm, yet the stakes are even higher now; the fate of Bretonnia itself hangs in the balance, for Zugrak Gobspit and his deadly Skullsmasherz have arrived. They are far more deadly than the average standard chaotic Greenskin host, so caution is advised lest the enemy surround and destroy the Bretonnian forces, their advances hidden beneath the all-consuming murk.
The Icons of Vilification, The Shadow Forest
The Icons of Vilification, Stir River
Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

Prince Sigvald faces the forces of his father's brother-Gods once more. They send forth their most repellent and disgusting beasts in a fit of jealousy and spite. Sigvald's host must face these beasts and by doing so prove he is worthy of a sliver of Slaanesh's very own blade.

The Dark Elves attack at Vaul’s Anvil, confident that they can rid the world of one of the greatest threats to their power. But the volcano is not the best battlefield for the attacker - its narrow confines mean the advantage is with the defender. Although, an enemy as desperate as the Druchii will not think twice before committing sufficient numbers to ensure Tyrion’s defeat!

As Kemmler's host step onto the frozen lake, the Lichemaster spots more minions of the Ruinous Powers hacking their way into the ice seeking out Krell's tomb. In response to his approach, the Marauders abandon their excavation and ready their weapons. It is a small force, and will quickly be overwhelmed. This is almost too easy!

Speed will win the day here, not always a Dwarfen characteristic, but perhaps recent innovations will plug that gap? In any case, those filthy grobi magic-users are making some ritual, they must be disrupted, and quickly, or no doubt tougher reinforcements will follow.

While in dock at Chupayotl, the Skaven strike! Their sorcerous leader believes they have weakened the Krakenlord, and while he licks his wounds and pride in port, the ratmen will take the spoils and infamy for themselves. But they could not be more wrong... they are not the hunters but the hunted! Fellheart knew the creature that cursed his helm would attempt an incursion here, so his crew lay in wait for the Skaven thieves to board. Afore the day is done, Fellheart shall sluice the decks in ratblood and restore the Helm of the Kraken to its former lustre!

This is a battle of bitter foes - there is more than mere honour at stake. The White Dwarf has encountered this Chaos Dragon before, when the fell creature struck the Ancestor Lord, shattering Glimril scales from Grombrindal's armour. Such a slight cannot remain unaccounted for - defeating the Chaos Lord will allow the White Dwarf to recover the scales and complete his armour once more. Such a thing is no easy task - Marbad's Tomb has seen much blood spilt and this battle will be no different. These Beastmen thralls are no ordinary Gors, and Tzeentch has supplied his servant with more than one surprise...

This is a battle of bitter foes - there is more than mere honour at stake. The White Dwarf has encountered this Chaos Dragon before, when the fell creature struck the Ancestor Lord, shattering Glimril scales from Grombrindal's armour. Such a slight cannot remain unaccounted for - defeating the Chaos Lord will allow the White Dwarf to recover the scales and complete his armour once more. Such a thing is no easy task - Marbad's Tomb has seen much blood spilt and this battle will be no different. These Beastmen thralls are no ordinary Gors, and Tzeentch has supplied his servant with more than one surprise...

Kemmler will use the Empire puppets to confront the Bretonnians. Let the foolish Knights smash their lances against the corpses of the broken Empire. When he strikes with the full might of the Undead, the abbey's secrets will be his!

The Asur, led by Tyrion, have foolishly blocked the Witch King’s path to the volcano and his objective: the Shrine of Vaul. They are not alone, however, as scouts report that Teclis has arrived to support his brother. Taking advantage of the situation, Malekith orders his expendable vanguard to take the brunt of Tyrion’s army, pinning down the enemy and paving the way for victory.

No more guile, now is the time to match blades in open battle. This horde is heavy with Orcs, but there are Trolls within the ranks too. Good! For what is the use of a Troll-slayer if there are no Trolls to slay!

This is a fell place. It reeks of dead umgi. Of the enemy, there is no sign yet... But Thorgrim must attend to claim vengeance on innocent Dawi that did nothing but travelled through the area to make a just profit. The High King has sworn that the Dammaz Kron will stay shut until vengeance is claimed.

This dark lair is home to a mage of some sort. Gelt can feel it's energy and the presence of Dark Magic. There are Undead here, of that there is no question, but what great monster has been summoned from its deathbed deep in the cave, Gelt is convinced he's about to find out...

This rogue Knight and his army sit in a most defensible position on the far side of the battlefield from the Duke's own force. Between them is an open field offering little cover. Beyond that Alberic must face the steeled, readied mercenary Knights. He must also beware of the guns used by these brigands – they would rather shoot from afar than fight with honour and courage. However, if Alberic holds true, then no force can forestall his judgement!

This is a tough fight amongst the beast-paths of the darkest forest. Malagor faces a Gorebull and his fierce Minotaur warherd. The Crowfather should use his superior arcane abilities to defeat and dominate the crude but powerful Minotaurs.

Blackfire Pass is a place of legend. Not only is it the scene of many a battle, its mountainsides are riddled with ancient Dwarf Halls and lost dungeons. These catacombs are prime quest territory for parties of adventurers searching for riches and lost heirlooms. One such party has emerged into the gloomy daylight to see Wurrzag’s army gathering in the pass. To take Wurrzag’s head as a prize, to deliver it before the Imperial throne, would be a great bounty. And so the heroes decide to attack, but they are not foolish enough to believe they can fight this hoard alone, they fight with a rapidly-approaching Empire army at their backs!

These ignorant Empire guards are ill-prepared to face Isabella's fury - there is no rage like that of the Vampire Countess, and she has much to dispense. Beyond them lies the tomb of Marbad the First Elector - who knows what has happened to him since his interment? The weak, pathetic Sigmarite soldiers may not even know what it is they defend!
Blood Chalice of Bathori: The Dead Wood

The Wood Elves are beset by tribulation! The Undead are swift and nimble; they will be upon Durthu's allies in short order! Whilst they can hold on for now, he must move swiftly to aid them or they will be completely overrun by the Undead menace. The Ashenhall is a craggy, obstacle-laden place, with many natural points of defence - the terrain is advantageous to he who holds it. Durthu must hold the enemy at bay until the Elves can regroup, then together they can smite the eldritch blight from these lands!

Grimgor must take on two separate stunty forces. Something he is more than capable of doing, but if the bearded gits try and play it sneaky, he may end up outmanoeuvred. These armies are not just keeping their squat legs on the ground either. Gobbo lookerz report lots of Gyrocopter squads. Cheating beardy gits.

This Glade Lord is beyond salvation! She has given herself wholly to the dark lord Slaanesh; she is nothing more than a puppet of Chaos now, she must be purged! Her retinue lies across from Orion, but there will doubtless be more coming to her aid. This aid will not take the form of Elves, however, as the Ruinous Powers seek to secure their fleeting foothold on this realm. Dark and corrupted forces will try to stop Orion in his endeavour, but he must hold firm against them all and recover the relic before it is snatched away beyond his reach.

This battle will be fought against a Knightly Order of the Empire. Armoured man-filth will be a challenge, as they are tough to gore and mobile due to their treacherous beasts. Corner them at the river and deal with them quickly, before reinforcements arrive!

To behold the Eye of Sheerian, Archaon must face a dread trial led by a Chaos Lord riding a monstrous steed. The battle will be brutal for the prize is highly valued - be it but another of the Everchosen's Unholy Quests.

After endless days trudging through the jungle, your warband arrives at a great temple scattered with the bones of beasts and other prey. It is a feeding ground. You turn to ask the Skink if this is the place to bait a trap, but the reptile has gone! All that remains is a shackle containing a foot gnawed through at the ankle. It seems the trap is not yours to set - for you are the bait!

column1: A great roar rumbles across the clearing, the ground shakes, birds scatter from the lush canopies, and the usually-loud jungle is suddenly silent... until pierced by another roar. Then, from the trees, a chanting is heard "Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan!"
The behemoth has arrived, and you must now fight a Carnosaur of legend!

column2: Despite the Shifting Isles, you arrive in time, as the volcano growls. Assuming the snivelling Druchii told the truth, the Mother of the Flame will rise from Vaul's Anvil at any moment. Then, you see the High Elves deploy their Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard - warriors sent to guard this mythical creature and a sure sign that this is indeed the right time.

column1: Break them apart to claim victory. This bird will make a perfect sacrifice!

column2: Dragon Cloak of Fyrskar, Broken Leg Gully (1)

The Undead adopt a defensive stance around their Lord. Pale skeletal warriors await the Dwarfs in a silence broken only by mindless moans of numberless Zombies and the feral cackling of Ghouls and other nameless horrors. Ungrim must strike, and strike now - for who knows what is being called to Undeath from within the cave.

The Dwarfs despise Skarsnik, and with good reason. They will fight hard, so the Warlord must use his superior deployment to outflank the bearded gits. Be wary of any reinforcements. As all gobbos know, Dwarfs have small legs so there's always a few running to catch up!

Ungrim will meet the Chaos scum in the high peaks of his mountain realm. This will be battle hard won, for the Northmen come as if sent by the Chaos Gods themselves to end the discordant song within the Axe of Dargo. A bitter fight then, and one the Slayer King must win!

The king must make his way through the Underway, an area under the dominion of urks and grobi. Be wary of the side passages, for it stinks of an ambush, even if the Everpeak Aircorps is en route to offer support.

The herd, and Morghur with it, had no idea that Orion and his warriors had located and infiltrated their secret beast-paths. And so the Elves descend upon them with pride and vengeance in their hearts. However, they are deep within enemy territory now and do not know from which direction further Beastmen may come to aid their brothers and forestall Elven vengeance. And so Orion must be swift, he must be strong and above all he must be furious; let the rage of the ancient forest of Athel Loren rain destruction upon these calamitous fiends, that they never darken the forest again.

The inconstant Eagle God knows each trivial seed of hate in man’s heart, just as it knows the ultimate fate of every star in the cosmos. Its plans are convoluted and vast, spanning across untold aeons, inexplicable and contradictory to mortal minds. Yet now the puppet master has one more plan – to send its challenger against those who shun it…
Cloak of Molten Metal, Ancient Dragon Cave

Beyond Black Fire Pass stands the lush humie realms, ripe for stomping. But first Grimgor must break through this army. The humies will be hard to shift, and there are rumours that they'll be getting stunty reinforcements. All things to consider, since Grimgor's force is all here with nothing left in reserve.

The Emperor is not best pleased that this battle is happening, but for Volkmar's sake he is loath to forbid it. If the enemy general, the Ar-Ulric's loyal servant, be slain then an uneasy peace should quickly follow between the two sides. By the same token, it is clear that the Ar-Ulric wishes the Grand Theogonist dead, thinking his replacement would be more amenable to Ulrican concerns... perhaps. For Volkmar to reclaim his staff it is clear he will need to slay the enemy Lord in Sigmar's name as quickly as possible!

The Greenskins sought to use the ancient halls of Belegar's Ancestors as a means to wreak havoc in the Karaz Ankor, but instead it is they who are undone - caught within the realms of the Dwarfs and trapped. Allies from Karak Azul will take the urks from behind. It is our job to face the urks head on and crush them!

Sigvald must face the forces of Chaos as he has done many times before. But this time he wants something more than the mere act of murder for murder's sake. The Chaos Lord will not give up his prize so easily, his army will be constantly reinforced, much to his stepfather's delight. This must be a test or trial of sorts!

Khazrak has caught his rival in-between raids on the man-filth towns. It is an excellent moment to strike - while much of the enemy herd are still in the midst of raiding. Hit Graktar's Gors quickly, for they will be certain to call back the herds to defend their lame master.

The Undead army is revealed and the White Dwarf is keen to halt this trespass into Valaya's realm. It is no surprise to Grombrindal that these dead urks are led by a Vampire. That must be dealt with quickly, but the rune that now glows brightly on the White Dwarf's cloak foretells that several waves of Undead are to be expected.

Kemmler decides the best way to rid Marbad's Tomb of the Goblin infestation is to lay a trap. His minions lie in wait - an ambush for the Goblinoids! When the Greenskins approach, via the channel between the hillsides, the Lichemaster will strike!
The Silver Seal, Shrine of Ill Omen (1)
The Silver Seal, Shrine of Ill Omen (2)

The men are correct to fear, something old stirs, and it does not welcome the invaders. Even so, Gelt has fought the Undead before, and this will surely be a small presence. He looks to the men, demands valour and then begins to channel the Winds of Magic.

The Undead legion marches west under the fearsome banner of von Carstein. Mannfred is determined to claim the Armour of Templehof from Grudsnik's tomb and will slay any mortal fool who gets in his way! Let the mortals think they can outwit the Count with flanking attacks. Mannfred is ancient, and has seen such archaic tactics many times before.

Druchii under Morathi's dominion intercept the Blood Queen's retinue. Hellebron is unconcerned, for the time of murder is at hand, and for every enemy throat severed and dedicated to Khaine her twin blades will find their edge once more. Yet… this battle – like all the events leading up to it – is of Morathi's machinations. Nothing should be taken as it seems.

Those who worship the Serpent God do so for pleasure and personal gain, knowing that he has it within his power to instil his followers with a portion of his radiant glory. The allure of the Serpent is highly addictive, and so it becomes infuriated at those who resist the lure of its pride, arrogance, and excess. Now it sends a challenger, as charismatic as all the Serpent’s Champions…
Monster Hunt: Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots
Monster Hunt: Blorgar the Mad Titan
Monster Hunt: The Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord
Monster Hunt: Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void
Monster Hunt: Brood Queens of Karak Azul

My Lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!
Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore
Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

Gelt must prepare for an arcane duel. Orr has always been a powerful rival, and highly-capable mage. He is sure to attack early, so Gelt must prepare his magical defences. He must also be especially wary, as the ambush will not be the only part of Orr's plan - he will have something else up his white robe...

The Greenskins of the Madmoonz tribe are entangled in a Skaven plot to destroy Clan Rictus. The notoriously lucky Tretch, however, is a master schemer himself and has uncovered the plot. Unable to move against the Council of Thirteen members behind the scheme, he is determined to make an example of the hapless Madmoonz. He advances on their underground lair in the far north, determined to take the skull of the tribal leader for himself as an emblem of his uncanny fortune.
